description: As a portrait painter, Sir Joshua Reynolds liked to give his sitters Classical attributes and poses. Dressed in robes, Lady Sarah Bunbury pours a libation of oil as an offering to the Three Graces, positioned behind her. Her fiancé, Charles Bunbury, commissioned this marriage portrait, making her association with the Graces—symbols of fertility and attendants to the Roman goddess of love, Venus—all the more appropriate.
title: Lady Sarah Bunbury Sacrificing to the Graces
